citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Male shih-tzu #39's right eye had wet hair around it with some minor crusted hair. The clear surface was slightly hazy with
some redness on the upper part of it and a brown round area in the upper part of the dark part of the eye (pupil). These
are signs of an active eye problem. This eye condition was pointed out to the licensee. Eye problems can cause
discomfort and worsen over time if not treated. Ensure that this dog's eye is seen by the attending veterinarian (AV) and
follow the AV's treatment plan. Ensure that a routine of daily observation of all animals is completed so that there can be
prompt and frequent communication on animal health problems with the AV.
***Correct by 11/11/2023.

The facility has a written plan of exercise, however it has not been approved by the new attending veterinarian for the
facility. Having an exercise plan approved by the attending veterinarian helps ensure dogs have enough space and
opportunity for exercise. Ensure to obtain the attending veterinarian's approval on the written exercise plan.
***Correct by 11/18/2023.

Female teddy bear #31 had areas of matted hair on the sides of her legs. Matted hair can cause discomfort and skin
problems. Ensure this dog's hair coat is trimmed and that a regular routine of preventive care such as hair coat care is
kept in place to prevent matted hair coats.
***Correct by 11/11/2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
Male shih-tzu #39's right eye had wet hair around it with some minor crusted hair. The clear surface was slightly hazy with 
some redness on the upper part of it and a brown round area in the upper part of the dark part of the eye (pupil). These 
are signs of an active eye problem. This eye condition was pointed out to the licensee. Eye problems can cause 
discomfort and worsen over time if not treated. Ensure that this dog's eye is seen by the attending veterinarian (AV) and 
follow the AV's treatment plan. Ensure that a routine of daily observation of all animals is completed so that there can be 
prompt and frequent communication on animal health problems with the AV.  
***Correct by 11/11/2023. 
3.8 
   
Exercise for dogs. 
The facility has a written plan of exercise, however it has not been approved by the new attending veterinarian for the 
facility. Having an exercise plan approved by the attending veterinarian helps ensure dogs have enough space and 
opportunity for exercise. Ensure to obtain the attending veterinarian's approval on the written exercise plan.  
***Correct by 11/18/2023. 
3.13(a)(4) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
Female teddy bear #31 had areas of matted hair on the sides of her legs. Matted hair can cause discomfort and skin 
problems. Ensure this dog's hair coat is trimmed and that a regular routine of preventive care such as hair coat care is 
kept in place to prevent matted hair coats. 
***Correct by 11/11/2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
